page.title: 13Teenagers' Slang
page.content: In the 1980's, we school children in Shawlands have accustomed slang names for objects or people we usually see everyday. For example, somebody who is really stupid and annoying we would call a "tube". If we had a carry on somewhere it would be called a "rammy". If someone was sour-faced about something someone might say "who stole your scones?" or be sarcastic by saying "why are you so happy?" If someone was being ignorant somebody might say "don't be iggy" meaning don't be ignorant. If someone was talking a load of nonsense they would be "rambling or rabbling". Someone who is embarrassed would either have a "beamer" or a "brassneck". A daft person would be known as "mental".
